Job Title: Senior Business/Data Analyst- Full time- Sharp Health Plan-San Diego
Job Description:
[Master's Degree; Bachelor's Degree

Hours


Shift Start Time:

8:30 AM

Shift End Time:

5 PM

Additional Shift Information:

Weekend Requirements:

As Needed

On-Call Required:

No

Hourly Pay Range (Minimum - Midpoint - Maximum):

$42.504 - $54.844 - $67.184


The stated pay scale reflects the range that Sharp reasonably expects to pay for this position. The actual pay rate and pay grade for this position will be dependent on a variety of factors, including an applicant’s years of experience, unique skills and abilities, education, alignment with similar internal candidates, marketplace factors, other requirements for the position, and employer business practices.


What You Will Do
Under the direction of the Lead Business Data Analyst, provides Sharp Health Plan with data, reporting and analyses that enable data driven Plan decision-making. Maintains the integrity and automation of Legacy Access databases, extensive spreadsheets, links data from different Legacy Access databases to include functionality of formulas, queries, importing and exporting of data to other programs.

Required Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree Health, business or computers (equivalent work experience may substitute for degree)
7 Years Experience in a Business/Data Analyst role.

Preferred Qualifications
Master's Degree Health, business or computers (equivalent work experience may substitute for degree)

Essential Functions

Communication
Interacts with team members, and other departments within Sharp Health Plan for the achievement of department goals and business needs.
Identifies clients and stakeholders for project definition and issue resolution.
Develops relationships with end users to understand business operations and entity goals.
Provides updates to management on overall department goals and major initiatives.
Documentation and change management
Updates documentation in Azure such that features and functionality are well documented and communicated.
Keeps documentation up to date to allow for the continuation of functions by other staff members when the primary resource is unavailable.
Utilizes Team Foundation Server for source control and change management for SSRS reports and stored procedures.
Follows best practices for change management processes and communication are utilized by team members so that the highest levels of system stability and reliability are maintained.
Leadership
Provides guidance and direction to new and/or junior staff when applicable.
Trains new and existing business/data analysts where applicable in system and operational tasks in order to maximize effectiveness and utilization of systems.
Proposes and implements creative solutions to operational and application issues with follow-through to resolution.
Independent worker, exercises discretion and makes decisions based on distinct issues.
Participates in other duties as assigned
Participates in special projects and other duties as assigned. These may include, but are not limited to: work groups, proposals, audits and back-up support for other departments.
Problem analysis and resolution
Analyzes complex issues and/or requests to provide effective and creative resolution. Utilizes various department tools and resources to develop quality reports and resolve problems.
Analyzes user needs/requirements through a variety of appropriate methods such as meetings, observing department operations, reviewing previous reports.
Applies creative efforts to resolve problem using best judgment and discretion.
Engages with Business Intelligence developers, other Data Analytics team members, or other departments within Sharp Health Plan to correct data integrity issues.
Provides the highest-level of troubleshooting ensuring all deliverables meet or exceed acceptable thresholds.
Provides and prepares analysis of reports to identify key trends.
Provides and prepares analysis of internal monthly reports to identify key trends, ensure data integrity, and assess Plan reporting capabilities. Consults with the CFO and CEO and/or Plan management staff with regards to key business trends, benchmarking data, utilization statistics, etc.
Project management
Demonstrates consistent and effective application of Project Management techniques.
Communicates in a timely fashion both to the requestor and management when project schedules may not be meet.
Provides executable alternative solutions to work around resource constraints.
Determines and plans for appropriate project task support and task communication.
Performs comprehensive risk identification.
Ensures adequate communication of project related issues.
Establishes and completes project documentation requirements in a timely manner.
Provides internal and external customer service
Provides prompt, accurate and excellent services to internal and external customers.
Develops solid professional working relationships with various internal departments and units and, as required, vendors, providers, employers, brokers and/or other customers.
Report preparation
Prepares ad hoc reports, assists with new reports and reporting capabilities, special projects, and additional assignments to meet the reporting needs of the department or the Plan.
Develops reports, design, build spreadsheets.
Extracts and compiles data information from a variety of internal and external sources.
Database maintenance
Maintains legacy Microsoft Access databases.
Prepares complex monthly reports for a variety of departments, extracts appropriate data fields and elements needed to produce these reports, reviews for accuracy, submits all reports in a timely manner.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Must have advanced skills in Excel, experience with merging large datasets and analyzing data, working knowledge of SQL, and with reporting tools such as SSRS and/or Tableau.
Working knowledge of procedure, diagnostic, and revenue coding (e.g., CPT-4, HCPCS, CRVS, RBRVS, RVS, ICD-10, etc.) and medical terminology.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, status as a protected veteran, among other things, or status as a qualified individual with disability or any other protected class

About Hyundai GLOVIS America Inc.

GLOVIS America, Inc. is a third-party logistics provider headquartered in Irvine, CA. Since our inception in 2002, we are committed to delivering our customers products via truck, rail, or ocean vessel throughout the U.S., Canada, and Mexico. Glovis America makes every effort to exceed standards by providing quality service to our customers and vendors of the automotive, freight forwarding, parts distribution, used car, and fuel industries. We cater logistics strategies and processes to our customers' needs by utilizing the latest information systems and advanced technologies.

Summary

This position will coordinate and communicate with customers to ensure timely and proper delivery of trailer orders. This position will assign carriers to deliver the trailers to the instructed destination within the budget and guidelines provided and will track production, inspection, ETA, and delivery, at all points until the trailers are delivered successfully and closed out formally.

Compensation

$45,000-$55,000/ Year

Responsibilities

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITY IS LOGISTICS COORDINATIONS & TRACKING
Plan upcoming units in Production and Quality Control to ensure the destination and transit type coincides with the customer's preferences and expectations on the delivery of their trailers
Coordinate with carriers to ensure delivery is instructed accurately and the trailers are delivered within our procedures and expected delivery dates
Track delivery with carriers until trailers are accepted by the customer and there is a proof of delivery signed by both parties
Communicate with customers to deliver full transparency on their units throughout the delivery, including daily communication on production, quality control inspection, availability of units, availability of carriers, expected delivery dates, delivery reports, and miscellaneous requests fulfilled to ensure expectations are met
Perform internal functions to assist team and other departments in order to combat discrepancies and fulfill customer needs, including POD auditing, profit and loss reporting, damage and total loss reporting, unit availability, and transit/carrier availability
Create outbound delivery reports by customers and report them to Hyundai Translead
Track unplanned inbound accessorial charges for future management decisions
Report weekly trailer delivery numbers for outbound goal monitoring
Track and plan for aging deliveries to promote customer satisfaction
Participate in special projects and other duties as assigned

Benefits of working at Hyundai GLOVIS America Inc.

Medical Insurance

Vision Insurance

Dental Insurance

Health Care & Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)

Basic Life and AD&D as well as Short and Long Term Disability

Paid Vacation, Holidays, and Sick leave

Pet Insurance

Hospital and Critical Illness Insurance

Wellness Program and Gym Reimbursement*

401(k) with Generous Matching

Referral Bonuses*

Auto Allowance*

Quarterly Employee Lunches, Summer Refreshments, and Monthly Team Building Activities*

Discretionary Bonuses*

Tuition Reimbursement*

Benefits may vary by location. All benefits pursuant to Company policy

Skills

Strong verbal and written communication skills Required
Excellent organizational and time-management skills Required
Proficient PC skills - Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, database management systems Required

Education & Experience

Bachelors Degree OR equivalent combination of education and experience Required
1-2 years of experience in Logistics or Supply Chain Required
3-5 years of experience in Logistics or Supply Chain Preferred

Physical Requirements

Ability to sit in front of a desk and/or in front of the computer for long periods
Repetitive use of hand/grasping product, writing, and typing
Stand/walk
Possibility of using heavy machinery such as fork lifts, yard mules, etc.
Use of operating machines of PC and printer
Possibility of domestic travel 20%
Seldomly carry/lift a maximum of 15 pounds

Job Title: Functional Systems Analyst, Human Capital Management (Job ID 2247)
Company Name: San Diego County Office of Education
Job Description:
Job Summary

The San Diego County Office of Education is recruiting to fill a vacancy for a Functional Systems Analyst, Human Capital Management in the Integrated Technology Services division. The position is under general supervision, formulates concepts for, develops, and supports the implementation and upgrade of the Human Capital Management System. Consults with technical and managerial staff and end-users to gather information related to the functional business requirements of clients and recommends best practice information technology solutions to problems affecting business operations.

Requirements / Qualifications

This position requires a combination of education, training and/or experience that clearly demonstrates possession of the knowledge and abilities detailed below. A typical qualifying background would include five years of functional Human Capital Management work experience including significant work within a Human Capital Management system. School district and Oracle/PeopleSoft experience is preferred.

Preferred Experience:

Oracle/PeopleSoft System Analysis and project experience in the following modules: HCM, Payroll, Time and Labor, Absence Management and Recruiting
Business analysis experience in: requirements analysis, systems design, and business process analysis
Experience resolving Peoplesoft Finance and/or HCM issues with end users The results of this recruitment will be used to establish an eligibility list to fill this vacancy and any other vacancies in this classification for the next six months.

In addition to your EDJOIN application, you must include the following attachments:

-Questionnaire link download and complete. Link righthand side of job posting (link is located on the external posing link)

-Resume, detailing education and experience

-Two (2) Current Letters of Recommendation

-Letter of Introduction -Copies of any certifications or college coursework to be considered

Comments and Other Information

The San Diego County Office of Education is an equal-opportunity employer.DIVERSITY STATEMENT: Because each person is born with inherent worth and dignity, and because equitable access and opportunity are essential to a just, educated society, SDCOE employee commitments include being respectful of differences and diverse perspectives, and being accountable for one’s actions and the resulting impact. Employment with SDCOE is contingent upon successful completion of a post-offer background check and physical exam, which includes a drug and alcohol screening.

Join our amazing team!
The San Diego County Office of Education is a collaborative organization
that works toward a future without boundaries for our students.
We are passionate about equity for students and employees, support innovative learning,
offer great employee benefits, and professional growth opportunities!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $71,823.00 - $91,669.00 per year

Benefits:

401(k)
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Life insurance
Paid time off
Parental leave
Professional development assistance
Retirement plan
Vision insurance

Schedule:

8 hour shift

Work Location: In person

Duties
You will provide cost analysis support for complex defense weapon systems programs, including life cycle cost estimating, contract proposal evaluation, and Earned Value Management analysis.
You will conduct data collection, research, and analysis.
You will build quantitative models to predict the future cost of complex defense weapon systems.
You will perform analysis to help Navy leadership make informative decisions concerning cost, budget, and schedule over the life cycle of Navy programs.
You will comply with Department of Defense and Department of the Navy weapons system acquisition policies and cost analysis policies.
You will lead parts of cost analysis and program office teams.
You will assist in training entry-level analysts.
You will communicate with acquisition program office staff, technical/engineering teams, defense contractors, and external government customers.
You will convert mathematical analytical findings into well-articulated, concise written products and complete detailed documentation of analytical data and methods.
You will deliver oral and written presentations of findings, defending your analysis.
Requirements
Conditions of Employment
Must be a US Citizen.
Must be determined suitable for federal employment.
Must participate in the direct deposit pay program.
New employees to the Department of the Navy will be required to successfully pass the E-Verify employment verification check. To learn more about E-Verify, including your rights and responsibilities, visit e-verify.gov
Within the Department of Defense (DoD), the appointment of retired military members within 180 days immediately following retirement date to a civilian position is subject to the provisions of 5 United States Code 3326.
Males born after 12-31-59 must be registered for Selective Service.
You will be required to obtain and maintain an interim and/or final security clearance prior to entrance on duty. Failure to obtain and maintain the required level of clearance may result in the withdrawal of a job offer or removal.
Successful completion of a pre-employment drug test (including marijuana) is required. A tentative offer of employment will be rescinded if you fail to report to the drug test appointment/fail to pass the test. You will be subject to random testing.
This position is covered under the Defense Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act (DAWIA). Certification in the Acquisition Functional Area and category assigned to the position is required within established category timeframes.
You must acknowledge in writing that you are accepting an appointment in the excepted service which does not confer competitive status, prior to appointment.
Qualifications
In addition to the Basic Requirements for this position, your resume must also demonstrate at least one year of specialized experience performing work equivalent to the next lower grade level (GS-13) or pay band in the federal service or equivalent experience in the private or public sector.

Specialized experience must demonstrate performing duties such as: 1) Leading and developing program life cycle cost estimates; 2) Providing contract cost evaluations; 3) Providing Earned Value Management analysis; and 4) Providing cost analyses expertise to support acquisitions decisions.

Additional qualification information can be found from the following Office of Personnel Management website:
https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-standards/#url=List-by-Occupational-Series

https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-standards/1500/operations-research-series-1515/
Education

Applicants must meet the following positive education qualifications requirements of the Office of Personnel Management (OPM) Qualifications Standards Manual: Applicants must possess:

Degree: in operations research; or at least 24 semester hours in a combination of operations research, mathematics, probability, statistics, mathematical logic, science, or subject-matter courses requiring substantial competence in college-level mathematics or statistics. At least 3 of the 24 semester hours must have been in calculus.

Additional information

This position is covered by the Department of Defense Priority Placement Program.

Several vacancies may be filled.

A tentative offer of employment will be rescinded if the selectee fails to meet the pre-employment requirements, including failure to report to any of the scheduled appointments.

Federal annuitant information: The selection of an annuitant is subject to the Department of Defense and Department of the Navy policy on the employment of annuitants. Policy information may be found at: http://www.secnav.navy.mil/donhr/Documents/CivilianJobs/FedCivAnnuitants.pdf.

Additional points are not added for veterans' preference; however, preference is still applied. Applicants eligible for veteran's preference will receive selection priority over non-veterans. If selected, you may be required to provide supporting documentation.

Certain incentives (such as Recruitment, Relocation or Student Loan Repayment) may be authorized to eligible selectees.

A relocation incentive is generally a single payment intended to offset some of the relocation costs experienced by the selectee. A relocation incentive may be authorized.

About Dexcom

Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. (NASDAQ: DXCM), develops and markets Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems for ambulatory use by people with diabetes and by healthcare providers for the treatment of people with diabetes. The company is the leader in transforming diabetes care and management by providing CGM technology to help patients and healthcare professionals better manage diabetes. Since the company’s inception, Dexcom has focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions that are best in class - while empowering the community to take control of diabetes. Dexcom reported full-year 2022 revenues of $2.9B, a growth of 18% over 2021. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additional offices in the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs over 8,000 people worldwide.

Meet the team:

Dexcom IT provides technology solutions and partners with the business to enable our mission to help as many people as possible gain control of their diabetes. The BI team interacts cross functionally with IT, R&D, and all business functions, including product management, compliance, data governance, and QA to ensure data analytics needs for the entire business are met within the boundaries of a regulated company. This team has a great team culture supporting each other in a fast-paced environment and dealing with shifting priorities with a positive attitude.

Where you come in:

Conduct day-to-day management of the Data Engineering, Data Analytics and Support teams, taking full ownership of staffing, human-resource activities, project priority and delivery, and resolving operational issues.
Formulate a global organization plan and build a talent pipeline to meet business goals and support current systems, while continually developing and inspiring team to help them grow in their career paths.
Deliver key enterprise datasets and data services to our various business departments to enable data analytic and scientist teams to gain valuable insights and facilitate decision making, to help achieve topline commercial growth, identify new market opportunities, and realize operational efficiencies.
Establish DataOps methodologies to deliver data services as automated, orchestrated data pipelines to ensure our datasets are always available and with high data quality.
Evolve the capabilities and maturity of the enterprise data lake by creating a multi-year strategy and roadmap to scale to future capacities, increased functional capabilities, and improved up-time, while aligning with the needs of product, engineering, architecture, and data science and analytics teams
Continue to innovate by observing industry trends and best practices, assessing new technology, and understanding product positioning. Balance innovation and operational stability of the platform
Establish intelligent monitoring practices to streamline end-to-end systems operation through alerting, pro-active self-healing, and operational KPI capture. Build HA/DR resiliency to meet 24/7 uptime and SLA levels.
Actively manage relationships with software vendors to influence longer-term capabilities, as well as manage outsourced consultancy partners, including setting expectations regarding deliverables, product quality, schedules, and costs
Collaborate effectively, building partnerships with product managers, engineering teams, data analytics/science teams, and business stakeholders across the company to drive key company data initiatives, and deliver the right solution with proper scope at the right time.
As a medical device company, ensure the organization understands quality and privacy standards, and verify ongoing compliance with HIPAA, GDPR, CCPA, PIPEDA, SOX, and FDA regulations, while also aligning with data governance and Information Security practices to ensure data is consistently secured.

What makes you successful:

You 8+ years of total software and data engineering experience, with at least 4 years acting as a developer/architect, and 3+ years of experience leading a team of software or data engineers in a management capacity.
You have Strong track record of leadership and people management, with a demonstrated record of recruiting, managing, and retaining talent in data engineering in both onshore/offshore models.
You have Proven ability to instill a strong team culture of ownership, collaboration, and outcome-oriented mindset.
You have background in building and operating robust, scalable, and efficient data pipelines for data extraction, ingestion, data transformation, and landing into data warehouses using DataOps methodologies.
You have experience managing software development with Agile methodologies such as Scrum/Kanban while participating in agile ceremonies. Demonstrated knowledge on how to construct projects within Jira as the agile tool and how to form well-structured epics and user stories.
You can understand complex tasks and goals. Drive projects to completion with limited supervision.
You can communicate and present to all levels of management.
Nice to have experience with GCP, Snowflake, Kafka and BigQuery.
Nice to have experience with Oracle EBS and Fusion, Salesforce.
Nice to have exposure to commercial, manufacturing operations, supply chains, or commercial/marketing organizations, and connecting data strategy to business strategy with executive leadership.

What you'll get:

A front row seat to life changing CGM technology. Learn about our brave #dexcomwarriors community.
A full and comprehensive benefits program.
Growth opportunities on a global scale.
Access to career development through in-house learning programs and/or qualified tuition reimbursement.
An exciting and innovative, industry-leading organization committed to our employees, customers, and the communities we serve.

Experience and Education
Typically requires a Bachelors degree with 15+ years of industry experience.
9+ years of successful management experience in relevant industry.

Company Description


At ServiceNow, our technology makes the world work for everyone, and our people make it possible. We move fast because the world can’t wait, and we innovate in ways no one else can for our customers and communities. By joining ServiceNow, you are part of an ambitious team of change makers who have a restless curiosity and a drive for ingenuity. We know that your best work happens when you live your best life and share your unique talents, so we do everything we can to make that possible. We dream big together, supporting each other to make our individual and collective dreams come true. The future is ours, and it starts with you.

With more than 7,700+ customers, we serve approximately 85% of the Fortune 500®, and we're proud to be one of FORTUNE 100 Best Companies to Work For® and World's Most Admired Companies™.

Learn more on Life at Now blog and hear from our employees about their experiences working at ServiceNow.

Unsure if you meet all the qualifications of a job description but are deeply excited about the role? We still encourage you to apply! At ServiceNow, we are committed to creating an inclusive environment where all voices are heard, valued, and respected. We welcome all candidates, including individuals from non-traditional, varied backgrounds, that might not come from a typical path connected to this role. We believe skills and experience are transferrable, and the desire to dream big makes for great candidates.


Job Description


What you get to do in this role:



Aligned to several Americas regions and territories, the Sales Operations Specialist will support the forecasting process and advise the sales force in commercial sales transactions.
Attend regional forecast calls and perform pipeline analysis to ensure forecast accuracy
Analyze and review current customer licensing, products and usage and identify new revenue opportunities
Suggest creative pricing and payment solutions balancing customer need and pricing policies.
Review Quotes and Order Forms for accuracy and completeness.
Ensure all Orders are approved within pricing and discount policies.
Interface to Deals Desk, Finance and Legal as needed (i.e. revenue recognition)
Interface with Order Management to ensure accuracy of booked sales opportunities in the ServiceNow sales automation tool.
Support sales organization’s requirement for Customer licensing compliance

Qualifications


To be successful in this role you have:

2-4 years of proven experience of Sales Operations in a software sales organization
Organized, with excellent attention to detail and the ability to work in a fast paced environment
Proficient in PPT, Word, and Excel
Experience with a CRM system
Has been in a role supporting Sales Reps and Sales Territories
Strong listening, analytic and organizational skills
Ability to prioritize to meet business needs
Effective communicator, both written and verbal
Team Player with positive attitude ready to work in a fast paced environment
Results Driven


For positions in California (outside of the Bay Area), we offer a base pay of $72,000 - $111,600, plus equity (when applicable), variable/incentive compensation and benefits. Sales positions generally offer a competitive On Target Earnings (OTE) incentive compensation structure. Please note that the base pay shown is a guideline, and individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as qualifications, skill level, competencies and work location. We also offer health plans, including flexible spending accounts, a 401(k) Plan with company match, ESPP, matching donations, a flexible time away plan and family leave programs (subject to eligibility requirements). Compensation is based on the geographic location in which the role is located, and is subject to change based on work location. For individuals who will be working in the Bay Area, there is a pay enhancement for positions located in that geographical area; please contact your recruiter for additional information.

Company:
Qualcomm Incorporated

Job Area:
Operations Group, Operations Group > Business Operations

General Summary:

Qualcomm is a company of inventors that unlocked 5G ushering in an age of rapid acceleration in connectivity and new possibilities that will transform industries, create jobs, and enrich lives. But this is just the beginning. It takes inventive minds with diverse skills, backgrounds, and cultures to transform 5Gs potential into world-changing technologies and products. This is the Invention Age and this is where you come in.

Job Overview:

The Qualcomm Technology Licensing (QTL) Business Operations team is seeking a Financial Analyst.

Looking for a qualified candidate to support the global 3G/4G/5G mobile device shipment forecast process. This candidate will be responsible for assisting with various forecast models, analyzing 3rd party & Wall Street research reports, system processing, maintaining Tableau dashboards, and creating executive level PowerPoint materials.

Eligible applicants must possess strong analytical and communications skills with the ability to prepare complex financial reports for management. Must be a self-motivated individual that produces accurate work product and is comfortable working in a fast-paced environment. Must possess the flexibility to work on various projects and deliverables simultaneous.

The role will consist of extensive Excel, PowerPoint, and Tableau use for projects and presentations. The candidate needs to have the ability to identify, recommend, and implement process improvements to existing complex processes. The ideal candidate should have experience synthesizing large/complex data sets and delivering high-level reports and presentations to management.

This position requires to work in the office at least 4 days a week.

Minimum Qualifications:

Associate's degree in Business Administration, Engineering, Finance, Marketing, or related field and 2+ years of business operations or related experience.
OR
High School Diploma or equivalent and 4+ years of business operations or related experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

Telecommunication/Semiconductor industry experience
TM1 / Tableau system experience
Presentation skills (effective written and verbal communication)
2-3 years’ experience in Finance or Accounting along with proficient understanding of MS Office Suite [Excel, PowerPoint] and other analytical tools [TM1 / Tableau a plus]

Although this role has some expected minor physical activity, this should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. If you are an individual with a physical or mental disability and need an accommodation during the application/hiring process, please call Qualcomm’s toll-free number found here for assistance. Qualcomm will provide reasonable accommodations, upon request, to support individuals with disabilities as part of our ongoing efforts to create an accessible workplace.

Qualcomm is an equal opportunity employer and supports workforce diversity.

Job Title: Manager, Strategic Analytics and Business Intelligence
Job Description:
Headquartered in San Diego, Mulligan Funding serves as a leading provider of working capital ($5K - $2M) to the small and medium-sized businesses that fuel our country. Since 2008, we have prided ourselves on our collaborative, innovative, and customer-focused approach. Enjoying a period of unprecedented growth, driven by the combination of cutting-edge technology, human touch, and unwavering integrity, we are looking to add to our people first culture, with highly motivated and results-oriented professionals, to push the limits of what’s possible while creating value for all of our partners.

We are seeking a highly skilled and visionary individual to join our team as the Strategic Analytics and Business Intelligence Manager. In this role, you will be responsible for spearheading the development and execution of a proactive analytics and business intelligence practice, enabling data-driven decision-making across the organization. Directly reporting to the Chief Analytics Officer, you will be the driving force behind ensuring data-informed decisions are core to our operations. This position offers the unique opportunity to craft the analytics roadmap and play a pivotal role in realizing the organization's overarching objectives.
You will:

Directly report to and collaborate with the Chief Analytics Officer, ensuring alignment of analytics strategies and practices with the company's strategic goals.
Lead and mentor the Data Analytics team, cultivating an atmosphere of collaboration, continuous learning, and innovation.
Lead the transformation of the analytics function from a reactive to a proactive approach, anticipating business needs and providing insights to drive strategic initiatives.
Develop and implement a comprehensive analytics roadmap, including the identification of key performance indicators (KPIs), data sources, and reporting frameworks.
Pioneer the creation of dashboards, reports, and tools that offer actionable insights to all levels of the organization
Implement advanced analytics techniques, such as predictive modeling and machine learning, to uncover opportunities for growth and efficiency.
Partner with department heads and business leaders to understand their needs and challenges, and proactively deliver analytics solutions that address their specific requirements.
Partner with IT and data engineering teams to ensure availability, integrity, and security of data.
Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in analytics and business intelligence.
Continuously assess and enhance the organization's analytics capabilities, processes, and tools to drive efficiency and effectiveness.
Present insights and recommendations to senior leadership, translating complex analytical findings into actionable business strategies.
Communicate the value of analytics and business intelligence initiatives to stakeholders across the organization.

You have:

A Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., Analytics, Business Intelligence, Data Science); advanced degrees are a valuable asset.
Proven experience leading analytics and data science teams for over 5 years, preferably in a strategic capacity.
Strong background in business intelligence, data analysis, and statistical modeling.
Expertise in analytics tools and platforms (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Python, R, SQL) and familiarity with data warehousing concepts.
Demonstrated ability to bridge the gap between technical analytics and business strategy
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey complex insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Strategic thinking, problem-solving abilities, and a track record of driving data-driven decision-making.
Experience working in cross-functional teams and collaborating with diverse departments, ideally within the financial services sector.

You may also have:

A proven track record of adapting to evolving compliance landscapes.
A thorough knowledge of data governance and privacy best practices.
A Master's degree, MBA, or comparable experience in business intelligence or related domains.

We offer:

Comprehensive medical, vision and dental benefits that give you peace of mind.
Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA) that let you use pre-tax dollars to cover healthcare expenses.
A fantastic 401K with matching contributions that helps you plan for retirement and build wealth over time.
Generous sick, vacation, and holiday benefits that give you the time and flexibility you need to enjoy life.
A gym membership contribution that supports your well-being, and helps you stay energized and focused.
An internal referral program that rewards you for bringing talented people to the team.
Company events that foster a positive and inclusive culture, and create opportunities to bond and grow with your colleagues.

Please note:

This position requires at least three days of on-site work each week at our San Diego, CA office, with the option for remote work during the remainder of the work week. This schedule provides flexibility and the opportunity for additional on-site work for those who prefer it.
Mulligan Funding is not offering relocation assistance for this role. Therefore, candidates should already reside within a reasonable commuting distance of our San Diego office or be able to relocate independently and promptly upon accepting an offer of employment. We expect new hires to be able to start within a reasonable timeframe after acceptance of an offer, as we may not be able to accommodate extended delays (beyond typical notice periods for current employment, etc.).

A reasonable estimate of the salary range for this role is $140,000 to $180,000 per year. In order to provide a competitive compensation package, Mulligan Funding takes into account a variety of factors including but not limited to market compensation data, relevant experience, skills, education, and certifications.
Mulligan Funding is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) and takes great pride in building a diverse work environment. Qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to age, race, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, disability or veteran status.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $140,000.00 - $180,000.00 per year

The primary goal of the Sales Analyst I is to support Kroger sales team, competitive and/or market intelligence reporting of the company by efficiently building and maintaining reports in Business Objects (Sales Data Warehouse), IRI, AC Nielsen or other systems as directed. The Associate Sales Analyst provides database, report, master data and application validation for the reporting applications that they are assigned and support. Support the team by completing spreadsheets and forms that support established business processes.
Continually measure, monitor and modify tactics to show progress against the team’s strategic goals.
Practices and complies with all Company policies and procedures (EEO, Harassment, Safety, Sarbanes Oxley, etc.). Performs other duties which are deemed by management to be an integral part of the job, including but not limited to fulfillment of work schedules, adherence to attendance policies, and other applicable operating rules, policies and procedures.

General Atomics Aeronautical Systems, Inc. (GA-ASI), an affiliate of General Atomics, is a world leader in proven, reliable remotely piloted aircraft and tactical reconnaissance radars, as well as advanced high-resolution surveillance systems.

We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Business Program Analyst to join our Program Process & Services team, located in Poway, CA. This position is responsible for leading business projects, process development, and process improvement related to Program Management Financials. This position will be involved in the development of requirements that drive improved integrations and automations across Program Management tools.

The successful candidate will have subject matter expertise and relevant experience in Project Management and Program Finance with large and/or complex DoD contracts.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

Under general direction, applies advanced knowledge to formulate and develop the delivery and/or execution of one or more internal Company products, solutions, processes, or business systems to improve data quality and consistency, add capability, or add efficiency to the execution of Company business.

Exercises judgement within broadly defined practices to contribute to the development of new concepts, techniques, and standards to ensure activities meet overall objectives. Issues faced are difficult and often complex.

Manages non-technical project completion using an internal customer perspective, typically from initiation through delivery including entire tool or system development, system integration projects, and business system and process development or modification.

Continually assesses project performance, identifies issues, and develops solutions to meet project goals and objectives. Develops appropriate reports to document performance and convey to leadership.

Analyzes, validates, and develops surveys and analysis of best practices for techniques and processes to optimize approaches and achieve more efficient results.

Develops and leads the communication/delivery of business system/process documentation including presentations, procedures, templates, training, and job aids.

Gathers and reports consolidated project status and financial information to leadership.

Develops metrics that provide data for business system compliance and process measurement, identifies indicators for future improvement opportunities, and drives implementation of solutions across the business.

Implements new or improved systems and processes, supporting the business as appropriate to ensure efficient implementation.

Monitors dependencies across multiple inter-related projects to maximize efficiency and ensure proper integration across the business.

Collects data to identify root cause of problems and may diagram and evaluate existing processes.

Participates in or may lead a central governing body to review/audit adherence to documented processes and procedures and aligns improvement activities to performance shortfalls.

Coordinates departmental and/or cross-functional teams to assign and prioritize tasks focused on delivering new or upgrading existing products and/or services in support of assigned projects.

May provide leadership and training to less experienced professional staff.

Responsible for observing all laws, regulations, and other applicable obligations wherever and whenever business is conducted on behalf of the Company. Expected to work in a safe manner in accordance with established operating procedures and practices.

Other duties as assigned or required.


We recognize and appreciate the value and contributions of individuals with diverse backgrounds and experiences and welcome all qualified individuals to apply.

There is a focus on quality and relevance, with a detailed understanding of the context of the data relative to the company’s operations and to the stakeholder’s needs with clear communication as to what has been done, and these changes recorded. This position reports into the Director of Business Intelligence.

Make data-driven decisions and recommendations

Articulately and concisely explain the implications of complex data maintenance

Data Maintenance

Manage incoming data and reporting requests and develop reporting solutions as needed

Internal Customer Relationships

Collaborate with IT, Development, Sales, and Business Excellence to ensure timely releases of projects and make sure database requirements for report production are sustainable

Work on multiple improvement tasks/projects simultaneously and participate as a strong individual contributor to assigned projects

Minimum of 5+ years’ experience working in Enterprise Data Warehouse and data analytics or relevant field

Significant work experience with SQL, Stored Procedure

Experience with Microsoft reporting SSMS, SSRS, SSIS and SSAS, and Power BI

Solid computer skills, including Microsoft Office and working with databases

Database structure and relationships

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Job Title: Senior Analyst, MQ Dedicated Truck Operations
Job Description:
About Hyundai GLOVIS America Inc.

GLOVIS America, Inc. is a third-party logistics provider headquartered in Irvine, CA. Since our inception in 2002, we are committed to delivering our customer's products via truck, rail, or ocean vessel throughout the U.S., Canada, and Mexico. Glovis America makes every effort to exceed standards by providing quality service to our customers and vendors of the automotive, freight forwarding, parts distribution, used car, and fuel industries. We cater logistics strategies and processes to our customers' needs by utilizing the latest information systems and advanced technologies.

Summary

The purpose of the Senior Analyst, Dedicated Truck Operations position is to coordinate with dedicated truck carriers & cargo shippers to ensure timely shipments movement for inbound and outbound operations while maximizing dedicated truck capacity while aligning with Glovis standards and Hyundai Translead's expectations.

Responsibilities

Follow SOP/KPI guideline to ensure timely allocation of dedicated carrier capacity for both Inbound & Outbound operation
Conduct & Follow through all aspects of dispatching process, including communicating internally & externally for coordination
Support manager to trouble shoot any issues related to Dedicated Truck carrier / Dispatch operations
Daily communication with carriers & cargo shippers/vendors
Produce periodic carrier KPI reports & monitor performance
Responding to customer complaints & be solution provider for MQ operations
Plan pre-determined routes & maximize carrier capacity
Monitor communication with all related parties to ensure timely transportation movements
Coordinate daily/weekly/monthly workload to each responsible carrier
Maintain proper records to track & trace movement data (document productivity)
Manage carriers to minimize in-transit damages and reduce usage of more expensive carriers
Analyze and identify opportunities to save freight costs in the supply chain process
Support with all data reconciliation with proprietary systems such as TMS
Support MQ's 3PL / REPO coordination with carrier assigned
Shipment data entry & report generation
Perform internal functions to assist other departments in order to review and resolve discrepancies and fulfill customer needs including POD auditing, profit & loss reporting, and perform root cause analysis and establish corrective actions to avoid repetitive occurrences
Recommend and implement strategies to continually improve department performance

Compensation Range

$55,000 - $65,000 per year

Medical Insurance

Health Care & Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)

Discretionary Bonuses*
Tuition Reimbursement*
Benefits may vary by location. All benefits pursuant to Company policy

Skills

Strong Verbal and Written Communication Skills Required
Proficient PC skills - Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Database Management Systems Required
Excellent organizational and time-management skills Required

Education & Experience

Associates Degree Required
3-5 Years of Experience in Logistics and Supply Chain Required

Physical Requirements

Ability to sit in front of a desk and/or in front of the computer for long periods

UC San Diego values equity, diversity, and inclusion. If you are interested in being part of our team, possess the needed licensure and certifications, and feel that you have most of the qualifications and/or transferable skills for a job opening, we strongly encourage you to apply.



Candidates hired into this position may have the ability to work hybrid or remote.

Special Selection Applicants: Apply by 10/24/23. Eligible Special Selection clients should contact their Disability Counselor for assistance.

DESCRIPTION

UC San Diego Health Sciences is a multibillion-dollar organization that comprises three professional schools, two hospitals, 20+ graduate degree programs, and 90+ core facilities and research units all working toward fulfilling its tripartite mission. Led by the Vice Chancellor for Health Sciences, it accounts for the majority of the University’s research and philanthropic portfolios, in addition to an expanding clinical footprint that spans the San Diego region. With more than 1,700 faculty and 17,000 staff, the Health Sciences is home to nationally recognized academic and clinical programs and has been identified as one of the premier biomedical research institutions in the world. As a top-ranking, future oriented organization, UC San Diego Health Sciences offers challenging career opportunities in a fast-paced and innovative environment. The Vice Chancellor’s Office follows a progressive philosophy of career-path development for its employees.

The Principal Information Systems Analyst, a Technical Leader at UCSD Health Sciences, specializes in ServiceNow development and business intelligence (BI) integration. With an in-depth capacity to analyze highly complex problems, the incumbent will design, code, and document highly integrated ServiceNow applications and facilitate enterprise service management processes. The role involves operational excellence, configuring ServiceNow modules, and providing mentorship to other developers, including leading and mentoring junior staff to foster professional growth. Collaborating with business units and IT teams, the incumbent will employ advanced scripting technologies like JavaScript and AngularJS to create robust, scalable, and highly integrated solutions.

This position will play a critical role in enhancing existing ServiceNow applications, working both independently and with process owners on highly complex tasks. The responsibilities encompass developing workflows, conducting root cause analysis, and integrating best practices in areas such as problem and change management. With a high degree of knowledge in ServiceNow, the incumbent will drive automation, innovation, and best practices, aligning delivery with organizational strategies and objectives, and maintaining a commitment to quality and excellence in Health Sciences' highly complex and highly integrated environment.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Nine years of related experience, education/training, OR a Bachelor’s degree in related area plus five years of related experience/training.

Advanced knowledge of programming languages such as JavaScript, HTML, and CSS; familiarity with relational databases and SQL, and experience AngularJS or Bootstrap development frameworks.

Demonstrated experience with the development, configuration, implementation and support of production and non-production ServiceNow instances.

Advanced skills associated with programming design, modification and implementation. Advanced knowledge of secure software development. Demonstrated ability to create software specifications.

Demonstrated advanced knowledge, skills and abilities associated with system problem identification and resolution. Knowledge necessary to design, set up, operate and correct malfunctions involving technology systems. Experience in incident response and digital forensics, including data collection, examination and analysis.

Advanced knowledge of business and process analysis functions. Knowledge of the design, development and application of technology and systems to meet business needs.

Demonstrated experience with database administration. Advanced knowledge of database management systems and standards. Knowledge relating to highly complex database system design. Advanced database querying and modeling skills working with moderately complex databases. Knowledge of conceptual database design. Skills necessary to develop procedures and standards relating to database management systems. Skills associated with implementing database enhancements that improve performance and reliability of the system at the software, hardware and operating system level.

Familiarity with logical data design and data mapping or data conversion.

Advanced knowledge of computer security tools, best practices and policies including demonstrated experience securing server-based software. Advanced knowledge of computer security tools, best practices and policies including demonstrated experience securing server-based software. Demonstrated skill at analyzing and preventing security incidents of high complexity. Strong security skills for protecting the operating system, software, data and hardware.

Knowledge of test application code in client server environment.

Ability to write technical documentation in a clear and concise manner.

Familiarity with data quality and governance issues and requirements.

Technical skill to develop, implement and test disaster recovery functions using backup technologies.

Demonstrated project management skills.

SPECIAL CONDITIONS

Must pass a background check.

Pay Transparency Act

Hourly Equivalent: $37.79 - $86.16

UC San Diego Health Sciences is comprised of our School of Medicine, Skaggs School of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences, The Herbert Wertheim School of Public Health and Human Longevity Science, and our Student Health and Well-Being Department. We have long been at the forefront of translational - or "bench-to-bedside" - research, transforming patient care through discovery and innovation leading to new drugs and technologies. Translational research is carried out every day in the hundreds of clinical trials of promising new therapies offered through UC San Diego Health, and in the drive of our researchers and clinician-scientists who are committed to having a significant impact on patient care. We invite you to join our team!

UC San Diego values equity, diversity, and inclusion. If you are interested in being part of our team, possess the needed licensure and certifications, and feel that you have most of the qualifications and/or transferable skills for a job opening, we strongly encourage you to apply.



This is a 100% Contract position for three (3) years. This appointment may be extended or converted to career status based on the needs and funding of the department.

This position requires a hybrid work arrangement, which includes a combination of onsite (1-2 days/week) and remote work.

DEPARTMENT OVERVIEW

Financial Operations operates within the umbrella of Business and Financial Services, encompassing the functions of Accounts Receivable, Cash & Merchant Services, Equipment Asset Management, and Strategic Design for Financial Operations at UC San Diego. This unit oversees the complete administrative spectrum of billing procedures, collections, revenue recognition, bank account management, merchant services, PCI compliance, project subledger financial management, business process improvements, and regulatory control over capital equipment.

THE "WHY"

This is an exceptional opportunity to do innovative work that means more to you and those we serve at UC San Diego. Recognized as one of the top 15 research universities worldwide, our culture of collaboration sparks discoveries that advance society and drive economic impact. Best practices and best people at the best place to work! Our candidates come from all walks of life and so do we. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it’s the right thing to do, but because it makes our organization thrive! Our organizational core values (People First, Innovation, Integrity, Excellence, Accountability) define the culture at Business & Financial Services and push us to be our best. We’re excited to grow our team and learn from people that want to make a difference. If you love what you do and comfortable with designing for the future, we encourage you to consider joining our progressive organization. We recognize that candidates come with a wealth of experience and talent beyond just the technical requirements of the job. Diversity of experience and skills combined with passion is the key to innovation and excellence. To do great, we have to be great. Our organization places particular emphasis on equity, diversity, and inclusion incorporating exit interview feedback to enhance retention efforts and advance issues affecting the overall staff experience. If you're a team player with bold ideas and execution, now is the right time to connect!

POSITION OVERVIEW

Serves as Integrated Solutions Analyst and Project Manager in Financial Operations -a division of Business & Financial Services (BFS). The Integrated Solutions Analyst and Project Manager is responsible for process management, business process analysis, and continuous improvement programs to optimize BFS processes and systems supporting the campus.

The Integrated Solutions Analyst and Project Manager serves as a liaison between technical teams and business stakeholders to ensure the successful execution of projects. This role encompasses project management, ROI analysis, process mapping, gap analysis, interviewing, data translation, and requirements development and review. Partnering with the Business Intelligence team, establish KPIs, metrics and develop reports. With wide-ranging experience, the Integrated Solutions Analyst and Project Manager applies business process and analysis concepts and organizational objectives to resolve issues and work on problems, up to and including the most complex, with little or no organizational precedent, where analyzing situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors.

You are encouraged to review additional information about our organization:

https://blink.ucsd.edu/finance/about-us/index.html

Benefits: http://blink.ucsd.edu/HR/benefits/work-life/health.html

Our employees enjoy competitive compensation packages and educational opportunities in a diverse, stimulating workforce. This position is also eligible for full:

1) Health/Dental/Vision Insurance

2) Vacation/Holidays

3) Life Insurance

4) UC Retirement Plan

QUALIFICATIONS

Project Management Professional (PMP), Lean Six Sigma Green or Black Belt certifications

Thorough knowledge of other areas of IT including business process methodologies and analysis techniques. Knowledge of metrics benchmarking, SQL and Dashboarding techniques using Oracle, Cognos or Tableau tools/ Knowledge of SQL (preferred) for data querying and analysis. Demonstrated experience with KPI development and maintenance.

Expert skills and methodologies associated with analysis of processes and issues, information flow and architecture. Conduct ROI analysis to evaluate project feasibility and potential benefits. Create process maps and perform gap analysis to identify areas for improvement.

Demonstrated experience with process analysis, systems analysis, process architectures and systems analysis methodologies and practices including traditional waterfall, Agile, Agile Scrum, UML, UML Enterprise, et cetera. Experience with Atlassian products including Collab and Jira.

Experience with process mapping tools such as LucidChart or ProMapp

Advanced experience with process, information and enterprise architecture frameworks such as Zachman, TOGAF (The Open Group Architecture Framework, DODAF, ITIL, et cetera).

Understanding and skill in highly complex processes and systems requirements documentation standards, such as Use Case modeling, User Story creations and narrative description. Demonstrated ability to create Business Requirements Documents.

Expert knowledge of business processes and procedures. Experience in business analysis, project management, and process improvement.

Demonstrated testing and test planning skills.

Intermediate to Advanced proficiency with Microsoft tools (Teams, OneDrive, Sharepoint, Word, Excel, etc.)

Exceptional communication, interpersonal, and organization skills.

SPECIAL CONDITIONS

This is three (3) year, full-time contract position with the possibility of extension based on department and/or funding availability.

Job offer is contingent upon successful completion of a background check.

Why Lytx?:
Lytx is seeking a highly motivated individual with outstanding problem solving, collaboration, and organizational skills for a fast-paced high-growth environment. Strong performance record of leading and achieving results, productivity improvements and applying data-driven decisions. Motivated by applying skills across a broad range of business challenges and developing criteria to drive decisions that have a positive impact to company profit and performance. You'll Get To:
Lead the development of Event Review configuration models to improve cost and accuracy to meet desired business objectives. (Weekly/Monthly/Quarterly/Annually).
Take business needs and translate them into requirements, submit business requirements to development teams and act as the program manager from submission, execution, and deployment on behalf of our event review team and business partners
Lead the creation and deployment of analytical analysis for short and long-term strategies, provide insights and recommendations to cross functional stakeholders for decision making.

Review and analyze quantitative historical data, device improvements, demand drivers, and feature changes with cross functional partners. Prepare data, statistical models, and evaluate results based on current and future changes.
Lead cross-functional research to identify improvements to device capture trigger rate for customer fleets contracted with Lytx
Lead the creation of reporting on Tableau to support partners and Lytx teams support our Event Review and Provisioning Teams
Lead our Recorder calibration program that is responsible to maintain accuracy of recorder events. This includes all partner work instructions, reporting, analysis, executive reviews, and program changes based on new product developments.
Act as SME with internal partners and clients concerning setting management questions.
Perform other duties as assigned

5-7 years experience in a data analyst, business intelligence or equivalent role
Ability to demonstrates in-depth Event Review setting knowledge, understanding of recorder device settings and knowledge of driver safety programs
Ability to communicate and work effectively with cross-functional departments from individual contributors to executives to influence and drive business outcomes with analytics
Persuasive analytical and complex problem-solving skills.
Highly Proficient with Microsoft Excel.
Proficient with SQL
Proficient with Tableau
Highly Skilled Project/Program Management
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Experience with NetSuite
Demonstrated Experience in working with Product Development, Engineering other technical teams
Demonstrated Experience in working on cross-functionals teams what include sales, operations, customer care and other client facing organizations
Experience in working with outsourced domestic and international partners that provide manufacturing services, forward & reverse logistics and inventory management a plus
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience required. MBA preferred
5+ years of work experience as an analysis

Innovation Lives Here

You go all in no matter what you do, and so do we. At Lytx, we’re powered by cutting-edge technology and Happy People. You want your work to make a positive impact in the world, and that’s what we do. Join our diverse team of hungry, humble and capable people united to make a difference.

Overview
Our Customer Experience (CX) Analytics team within TurboTax is customer obsessed and fearless in our pursuit of data backed insights and tech led continuous improvements. Inspiring action and informing decisions across the business, driving toward our growth and retention goals.
What you'll bring
Bachelor’s Degree, or equivalent work experience, in Quantitative field or commensurate experience (Statistics, Applied Math, Econometrics, Operations Research). Master’s degree preferred.
10+ years’ professional experience with data and statistical analysis, with a deep understanding of explanatory power and hypothesis-driven analyses.
Data mining algorithms and statistical modeling techniques such as clustering, classification, regression, decision trees, neural nets, support vector machines, genetic algorithms, anomaly detection, recommender systems, sequential pattern discovery, and text mining.
Experience with tools to analyze, manipulate and visualize datasets (e.g. SQL, Excel/Sheets, Python, Splunk, Tableau, Qlik).
Proven track record of data visualization and story-telling, to develop actionable insights and business impact.
Experience working with operational KPI metrics & reporting systems
How you will lead
Investigator: Translate business questions into verifiable hypotheses, create experiments and/or analysis to test them, and generate recommendations based on the findings. You collect requirements and execute queries to answer the team’s most important data questions
Dot-Connector: Your business and operational acumen help you recognize patterns, connections and relationships across variables. You make the connections across data sets to help others understand the broader system.
Artist: your visualization, simplicity and clarity of analysis brings data to life and inspires action and understanding.
Craftsman: You build models and reports that allow others to interact, utilize and better understand the underlying data, relationships and insights.

Job Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (ON-SITE CA RESIDENTS ONLY)
Job Description:
About API

Alvarado Parkway Institute (API) is San Diego's leading provider of comprehensive mental health and substance abuse care. As a part of our Behavioral Healthcare system, API operates a free-standing 66-bed psychiatric hospital in La Mesa, California with four Intensive Outpatient/Partial Hospitalization Programs. These programs emphasize symptom management, community integration, and prevention of hospitalization or re-hospitalization.

The Business Intelligence Analyst will apply their advanced level of clinical and financial analysis and knowledge of systems to design and build financial management and reporting systems within API. Requires advanced level of proficiency in Excel, Power BI and MS SQL/Access, database design and management. Requires the ability to work with department leaders to gain understanding of reporting needs and build systems to and processes to improve efficiencies. Design and develop Business Intelligence reporting dashboards that articulate business trends providing leadership with improved decision-making capabilities.

You must complete an application online at our website to be considered for possible employment: https://apibhs.com/careers

Key Responsibilities:

Work with IT Director and department leaders to determine reporting needs across API departments
Design and build business intelligence dashboards in Power BI
Design and build reports for staff/end-users in Crystal, MS Access, SQL Report Builder or similar tools
Serve as the expert for accessing and utilizing the EHR Thrive Postgres database for reporting needs
Design, create and maintain, SQL Database(s) as required including data transformation/scrubbing inbound data from multiple sources
Work with department leaders to take Excel spreadsheets then design, and build SQL Database with user friendly front end to improve business processes along with required reporting features
Develop project plans/schedules for database reporting and related projects
Document all databases, queries and reports in our WiKi and GitLab repositories
Provide IT support to staff as needed (Potential for 7/24 on-call duty)
Qualifications
Bachelors or Masters degree in computer science or related field
Prefer 2+ years as a database administrator with a heavy emphasis on Database design, maintenance and data extraction
Prefer 2+ years Experience designing and building “Business Intelligence” dashboards using Power BI or similar tools
Advanced MS Excel and MS SQL/Access skills including experience with visual basic ODBC data extraction, user interface design for data entry and reporting
PowerShell Scripting experience
Ability to work independently and on a team, be flexible and adaptable, ready, willing and able to learn new technologies
Ability to use discretion, exercise good judgment and maintain confidentiality
Must provide an excellent service-oriented attitude and effectively communicate with a diverse user community at all levels of the organization
Experience in a Healthcare/HIPAA/Joint Commission covered organization is preferred

THOR Solutions is actively seeking a Submarine Operations Analyst to support the Naval Surface and Mine Warfighting Development Center (SMWDC) in San Diego, CA. The analyst will provide support developing naval exercise objectives, performing acoustic modeling, planning and observing exercises, collecting data for anti-submarine warfare, and post-exercise reconstruction and analysis, and communicate exercise results orally and in written formats to support products for representatives of naval commands, engineering labs, and program offices.

Typical Responsibilities:

Design test and data collection plans for exercises.
Act as lead observer aboard exercise units to coordinates observation and data collection efforts to support exercise reconstruction.
Develop exercise messages.
Reconstruct exercise events.
Analyze exercise results in accordance with the Analysis Plan.
Author analytical reports such as Reconstruction and Analysis, Cross or Focused Study, and Annual Reports.

Location: Fully onsite at SMWDC in San Diego, CA.

Target Pay Range: $100K – $104K /year

Travel: As much as 25 to 50% travel is anticipated.

Typical Physical Activity: Desk/computer work in an office environment. May involve: repetitive motion. Training/instructor work in a classroom environment. May involve: hearing or talking.

Existing Secret Security Clearance Required: This position requires an existing DoD Secret security clearance. A qualified candidate must already possess an active full or interim Secret security clearance and maintain it for the duration of employment.

Typical Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

High school diploma/GED equivalent.
Associate degree in a relevant discipline is preferred.
At least three (3) years of U.S. Navy experience related to submarine operations and warfare tasks. Experience should include:
Planning exercise activities including submarines.
Modeling acoustic environments.
Developing movement plans and maneuver schemes.
Drafting test and data collection plans.
Navy ship data collection, mission data extraction, and post mission analysis.
Knowledge of analytic tools for acoustic predictions.
Ability to develop technical documents in support of exercise planning, execution, reconstruction, and analysis.
Experience with drafting messages in standard Navy message format.
Experience with PCIMAT, EIPB, and NCOM.
Knowledge of AXP-1, MXP-1, OPORD 2000, and Fleet and ASW OPORDS.
Proficiency with common productivity software including Microsoft Office applications such as Outlook, Word, Excel, and Access.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Are you a team player? Are you curious to learn? Are you interested in working in meaningful projects? Do you want to work with cutting-edge technology? Are you interested in being part of a team that is working to transform and do things differently? If so, LPL Financial is the place for you!

Excited to learn more? If so, then this could be the role for you!

LPL Financial (Nasdaq: LPLA) was founded on the principle that the firm should work for the advisor, and not the other way around. Today, LPL is a leader* in the markets we serve, supporting more than 18,000 financial advisors, 800 institution-based investment programs and 450 independent RIA firms nationwide. We are steadfast in our commitment to the advisor-centered model and the belief that Americans deserve access to personalized guidance from a financial advisor. At LPL, independence means that advisors have the freedom they deserve to choose the business model, services, and technology resources that allow them to run their perfect practice. And they have the freedom to manage their client relationships, because they know their clients best. Simply put, we take care of our advisors, so they can take care of their clients.

Job Overview:
The Senior Analyst will support the setup and integration of new clients on to the LPL Enterprise (LPLE) platform across all investment products and trading platforms (Mutual Funds, Equity, Fixed Income, Annuity, Alternative Investment, Centrally Managed Accounts, and the Enhanced Trading Support Desk). This includes supporting research, analysis, implementation and documentation to setup the firm’s (trading) sub-region, creating and overseeing execution of user acceptance testing requirements, onboarding representatives to the LPLE platform, and partnering with the trading organization and LPLE representatives to navigate and resolve trading service and operational issues. The senior analyst would also maintain controls, compliance manuals, and other key artifacts to ensure ongoing regulatory compliance. Supervisory oversight will include, but is not limited to, trade correction principal review. The role will report to Vice President of LPLE Trading.


Responsibilities:

Execute integration strategy for LPLE and future LPLE clients on behalf of LPL Trading while meeting defined timelines and tollgates. This will include creating business requirements, testing strategy and UAT support for both establishment of the firm’s (through BETA) sub-region, all trading applications, telecom, and support model needs.

In partnership with Trading desks, identify, document, and solution for any future state needs of new clients to the LPLE platform.

Serve as a point of contact between the trading organization and LPLE enterprises.

Facilitate the development, implementation, and maintenance of Policies & Procedures, Key & Non-Key controls, Written Supervisory Procedures, and Advisor Compliance Manuals unique to LPLE.

Ensure ongoing regulatory compliance, firm policies and perform risk and controls oversight (including principal review of trade corrections for LPLE).



What are we looking for?
We want strong collaborators who can deliver a world-class client experience. We are looking for people who thrive in a fast-paced environment, are client-focused, team oriented, highly organized, and can execute in a way that encourages creativity, continuous improvement, and timely execution.

Requirements:

Demonstrated project management or business analyst experience in a trading environment.

Series 7 and Series 24 AND 63 or 66 Licenses.

Demonstrated experience across advisory, brokerage, and various security types.

Familiar with regulatory and industry related trading practices.

Core Competencies:

Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate to various levels of staff and senior leadership and articulate back-office trading functions across multiple security types

Highly organized with ability to manage multiple tasks with differing priorities and timelines.

Positive attitude and ability to adapt to various situations.

Superior service skills demonstrated through previous feedback.

Team oriented and able to work effectively with cross-functional teams.

Solution oriented with strong ability to collaborate within and outside the firm.

Preferences:

Experience across advisory, brokerage, and various security types.

Bachelor's degree in a related field

Experience with Jira and Confluence preferred.

Proficient in Microsoft PowerPoint, Excel, and Word.


Pay Range:

$69,840-$104,760/year


Actual base salary varies based on factors, including but not limited to, relevant skill, prior experience, education, base salary of internal peers, demonstrated performance, and geographic location. Additionally, LPL Total Rewards package is highly competitive, designed to support your success at work, at home, and at play – such as 401K matching, health benefits, employee stock options, paid time off, volunteer time off, and more. Your recruiter will be happy to discuss all that LPL has to offer!


Why LPL?

At LPL, we believe that objective financial guidance is a fundamental need for everyone. As the nation’s leading independent broker-dealer, we offer an integrated platform of proprietary technology, brokerage, and investment advisor services. We provide you with a work environment that encourages your creativity and growth, a leadership team that is supportive and responsive, and the opportunity to create a career that has no limits, only amazing potential.

We are one team on one mission. We take care of our advisors, so they can take care of their clients.

Because our company is not too big and not too small, you can seize the opportunity to make a real impact. We are committed to supporting workplace equality, and we embrace the different perspectives and backgrounds of our employees. We also care for our communities, and we encourage our employees to do the same. This creates an environment in which you can do your best work.

We take social responsibility seriously. Learn more here

Want to see info on our benefits? Learn more here
